item.title: Designing a Hiring Strategy
item.description: Let’s face it: most of the companies out there (including most of the ones I worked for) hire opportunistically. They wait until they have a specific need, then quickly put together a job description, and publish the opening in the various channels that are readily accessible, hoping that they get a fit. Most of the time they can’t find what they are looking for in a reasonable amount of time, and for the right salary.

item.title: Developers write code, Software Engineers solve problems
item.description: A long time ago, I was in Barcelona attending an API workshop with our teams there. On the second day of the workshop, the discussion got a bit sidetracked, but it was one of those sidetracks that leads to insights that are more valuable than the main theme of the workshop. I remember the group CTO at the time declaring “Developers write code, Software Engineers solve problems!”. For some reason it struck me as such a profound statement, that I still remember it to this day as the main idea of value I got that day.
